DataElement.preferredName: Lymphoma Histology Conversion And Diagnosis Same Occurrence Date Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the date of the lymphoma histology transformation was the same as the date of diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphoma Histology Conversion And Diagnosis Same Occurrence Date
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree._Occurrence; an instance of something happening._a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. Concepts.definition: A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree. :Occurrence; an instance of something happening.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Equal, or closely similar or comparable, in kind or quality or quantity or degree.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
